definitions: Roman emperor from 54 to 68 AD known for persecution of Christians and artistic pretensions
software application for burning and copying optical discs on personal computers
examples: Nero allegedly played the fiddle while Rome burned in 64 AD
The reign of Nero marked a turning point in Roman imperial history
I used Nero to burn my backup files onto a DVD
The latest version of Nero includes advanced disc authoring features

definitions: pioneering internet browser company and software that dominated web browsing in the mid-1990s
examples: Netscape Navigator was the most popular browser before Internet Explorer took over
The browser wars between Netscape and Microsoft shaped the modern internet

definitions: western US state known for Las Vegas, desert landscapes, and legalized gambling
examples: Nevada attracts millions of tourists to its casinos every year
The Silver State of Nevada was admitted to the Union in 1864

definitions: easternmost province of Canada comprising the island of Newfoundland and mainland Labrador
large working dog breed originally from Newfoundland known for water rescue abilities
examples: Newfoundland joined Canadian Confederation as the tenth province in 1949
The fishing industry has historically been vital to Newfoundland's economy
The Newfoundland dog rescued the drowning child from the lake
Our black Newfoundland weighs over one hundred and fifty pounds

definitions: surname of Sir Isaac Newton, English physicist and mathematician who formulated laws of motion
SI unit of force equal to the force needed to accelerate one kilogram by one meter per second squared
examples: Newton revolutionized physics with his three laws of motion
The apple tree story about Newton discovering gravity is probably apocryphal
The force exerted was measured at approximately ten newtons
One newton equals roughly the weight of a small apple on Earth

definitions: relating to the physical theories and methods developed by Isaac Newton, especially classical mechanics
examples: Newtonian mechanics accurately describes motion at everyday speeds and scales
Einstein's relativity superseded Newtonian physics for extreme conditions

definitions: famous waterfalls on the border between Ontario, Canada and New York State, USA
examples: Niagara Falls attracts millions of honeymooners and tourists annually
The thundering waters of Niagara can be heard from miles away

definitions: Central American country bordered by Honduras and Costa Rica, with coastlines on both Pacific and Caribbean
examples: Nicaragua is the largest country in Central America by land area
Coffee and beef are major exports from Nicaragua to international markets

definitions: person from Nicaragua or relating to Nicaragua, its people, culture, or language
examples: The Nicaraguan poet Rubén Darío founded the modernismo literary movement
Traditional Nicaraguan cuisine features gallo pinto as a staple dish

definitions: Friedrich Nietzsche, influential German philosopher known for nihilism, the Übermensch concept, and declaring God is dead
examples: Nietzsche challenged traditional morality in his philosophical writings
The concept of eternal recurrence was central to Nietzsche's philosophy

definitions: landlocked West African country named after the Niger River, bordered by Libya, Chad, and Nigeria
major West African river flowing through several countries including Guinea, Mali, Niger, and Nigeria
examples: Niger faces significant challenges from drought and desertification
The capital of Niger, Niamey, sits on the banks of the river
The Niger River is the third longest river in Africa
Ancient trade routes followed the Niger River through the Sahel

definitions: most populous country in Africa, located in West Africa with significant oil reserves
examples: Nigeria is often called the Giant of Africa due to its large population
Lagos was the capital of Nigeria before it moved to Abuja

definitions: person from Nigeria or relating to Nigeria, its people, culture, or languages
examples: Nigerian authors like Chinua Achebe gained international literary recognition
The Nigerian film industry, Nollywood, produces thousands of movies annually

definitions: period of darkness between sunset and sunrise when the sun is below the horizon
evening or night regarded as a time for a particular activity or entertainment
examples: The stars were brilliantly visible in the clear night sky
She worked the night shift at the hospital emergency room
They enjoyed a night at the opera for their anniversary
Friday night is traditionally movie night for our family

definitions: small brown bird famous for its powerful and beautiful song, especially at night
Florence Nightingale, founder of modern nursing who served in the Crimean War
examples: The nightingale's melodious song filled the moonlit garden
Keats wrote his famous ode inspired by a nightingale's song
Florence Nightingale revolutionized hospital sanitation and nursing practices
The Nightingale Pledge is named in honor of the nursing pioneer

definitions: major global corporation producing athletic footwear, apparel, and sports equipment
ancient Greek goddess of victory often depicted with wings
examples: Nike sponsors many of the world's top athletes and sports teams
The iconic Nike swoosh logo was designed for just thirty-five dollars
The statue of Nike of Samothrace is displayed in the Louvre
Nike was often portrayed crowning victorious warriors in ancient art

definitions: longest river in the world, flowing northward through northeastern Africa to the Mediterranean Sea
examples: Ancient Egyptian civilization developed along the banks of the Nile
The Blue and White Nile converge at Khartoum in Sudan

definitions: ancient Assyrian capital city on the Tigris River, located in present-day Iraq near Mosul
examples: Nineveh was one of the greatest cities of ancient Mesopotamia
The biblical story of Jonah involves his preaching in Nineveh

definitions: quick small bite or pinch with teeth or a tool
sharp feeling of cold that stings exposed skin
small quantity of spirits or alcoholic drink
examples: The puppy gave her finger a playful nip
She used scissors to nip the dead flowers from the plant
There was a definite nip in the autumn morning air
The frost nip damaged the tender young plants overnight
He took a quick nip of whiskey to warm himself up
She keeps a nip of brandy in her desk drawer

definitions: major Japanese multinational automobile manufacturer headquartered in Yokohama, producing cars and trucks globally
examples: Nissan was one of the first manufacturers to mass-produce electric vehicles
The Nissan Altima remains one of the best-selling sedans in America

definitions: Richard Nixon, 37th President of the United States who resigned in 1974 due to the Watergate scandal
examples: Nixon opened diplomatic relations with China in 1972
The Watergate scandal forced Nixon to become the only president to resign

definitions: biblical patriarch who built an ark to save his family and animals from the great flood
common male given name of Hebrew origin meaning rest or comfort
examples: Noah followed God's instructions to build the ark before the flood
The story of Noah appears in Genesis and the Quran
Noah was the most popular boy's name in many countries last year
My nephew Noah just started kindergarten this fall

definitions: Alfred Nobel, Swedish inventor of dynamite who established the Nobel Prizes, or the prestigious prizes themselves
examples: The Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded to the poet last year
Alfred Nobel left his fortune to establish the international prizes

definitions: French word for Christmas, often used in carols and holiday contexts
given name for boys or girls, especially those born around Christmas
examples: The choir sang The First Noel at the Christmas Eve service
Noel decorations filled the shop windows in December
Their daughter Noel was born on Christmas morning
The actor Noel Coward was a master of witty dialogue

definitions: person who refuses to conform to established customs, attitudes, or ideas
member of a Protestant church in England that does not conform to the Church of England
examples: The artist was a nonconformist who challenged traditional painting styles
Her nonconformist approach to business led to innovative solutions
The Nonconformist chapels played an important role in Welsh culture
Many Nonconformist denominations emerged during the English Reformation

definitions: relating to Scandinavia, Finland, and Iceland, or their peoples, cultures, and languages
examples: Nordic design emphasizes simplicity, functionality, and natural materials
The Nordic countries consistently rank high in quality of life surveys

definitions: member of the Viking people who settled in northern France and conquered England in 1066
Romanesque architectural style used by the Normans, especially in England
common male given name of Germanic origin meaning northman
examples: The Norman Conquest of 1066 transformed English language and culture
William the Conqueror led the Norman invasion of England
Durham Cathedral is a magnificent example of Norman architecture
The massive Norman arches are characteristic of eleventh-century churches
Norman Rockwell painted idealized scenes of American life
My grandfather Norman served in the Second World War

definitions: historical region in northern France, site of the D-Day landings in World War II
examples: The beaches of Normandy witnessed the Allied invasion on D-Day
Normandy is famous for its apple orchards and Camembert cheese

definitions: relating to ancient or medieval Scandinavia, its peoples, language, or mythology
examples: Norse mythology features gods like Thor, Odin, and Loki
The Norse sagas preserve medieval Scandinavian history and legends

definitions: medieval Scandinavian person, especially a Viking warrior or explorer from Norway, Denmark, or Sweden
examples: The Norsemen established settlements from Greenland to Constantinople
Fearsome Norseman raiders terrorized European coasts for centuries

definitions: direction toward the North Pole, opposite to south on a compass
northern part or region of a country, continent, or area
examples: The compass needle always points toward magnetic north
We drove north for three hours to reach the mountains
The North experienced rapid industrialization during the nineteenth century
Property prices are generally lower in the north of England

definitions: direction or point on the compass halfway between north and east
northeastern part of a country or region, especially of the United States
examples: The storm is moving northeast at twenty miles per hour
Their house faces northeast to catch the morning sun
The Northeast includes states like New York, Massachusetts, and Maine
Many prestigious universities are located in the American Northeast

definitions: situated in, directed toward, or coming from the north part of an area
examples: The northern lights danced across the Arctic sky last night
Northern Italy has a different cuisine from the southern regions

definitions: direction or point on the compass halfway between north and west
northwestern part of a country or region, especially the Pacific Northwest
examples: The plane flew northwest across the Atlantic Ocean
The wind is blowing from the northwest today
The Pacific Northwest is known for its rainy climate and forests
Seattle and Portland are major cities in the Northwest

definitions: person from Norway or the North Germanic language spoken in Norway
examples: The Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen reached the South Pole first
Norwegian salmon is exported to restaurants around the world

definitions: standard three-letter abbreviation for November, the eleventh month of the year
examples: The conference is scheduled for Nov 15-17 this year
Please submit your report by Nov 30 at the latest

definitions: eleventh month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, having thirty days
examples: Thanksgiving is celebrated in November in the United States
The leaves turn brilliant colors in November before winter arrives

definitions: hard-shelled fruit of certain plants containing an edible kernel
metal fastener with internal threads that screws onto a bolt
informal term for person who is extremely enthusiastic about something or considered crazy
examples: Squirrels gather nuts to store for the winter months
She's allergic to tree nuts like almonds and cashews
Tighten the nut onto the bolt using a wrench
The wheel came loose because the lug nuts weren't properly secured
He's a complete nut about vintage motorcycles
You'd have to be nuts to go swimming in this weather

definitions: organic light-emitting diode technology used in screens that produces light through organic compounds
examples: OLED televisions offer superior contrast ratios compared to LCD displays
The new smartphone features a vibrant OLED screen with deep blacks

definitions: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries, international cartel coordinating petroleum policies among member nations
examples: OPEC decisions significantly influence global oil prices and supply
The OPEC embargo of 1973 caused a major energy crisis

definitions: Occupational Safety and Health Administration, US federal agency ensuring safe working conditions through standards and enforcement
examples: OSHA regulations require hard hats on all construction sites
The company was fined for violating OSHA workplace safety standards

definitions: countries of Europe and the Americas, especially in contrast to Asia or the Orient
examples: Medieval traders brought spices from the Orient to the Occident
The cultural exchange between Orient and Occident shaped global civilization

definitions: person from the Western world, or relating to the countries of Europe and the Americas
examples: The Occidental tourists were fascinated by the Eastern temple architecture
Occidental philosophy differs from Oriental thought in fundamental ways

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the ocean, especially the open sea beyond coastal waters
examples: Oceanic currents regulate global climate patterns and weather systems
The oceanic crust is thinner but denser than continental crust

definitions: standard three-letter abbreviation for October, the tenth month of the year
examples: The festival runs from Oct 1 through Oct 31
Please renew your membership before Oct 15

definitions: tenth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, having thirty-one days
examples: October brings colorful autumn foliage to the northern hemisphere
Halloween is celebrated on the last day of October

definitions: long eventful journey marked by many changes of fortune and notable experiences
ancient Greek epic poem attributed to Homer about Odysseus's journey home from Troy
examples: Her career was an odyssey through different industries and countries
The refugee's odyssey to safety took three years
The Odyssey remains one of the foundational works of Western literature
Students studied Homer's Odyssey in their classical literature course

definitions: SI unit of electrical resistance, equal to the resistance between two points when one volt produces one ampere
examples: The speaker has an impedance of eight ohms
This resistor is rated at one thousand ohms

definitions: annual German beer festival held in Munich, or similar autumn beer celebration elsewhere
examples: Millions of visitors attend Munich's Oktoberfest every September and October
The local Oktoberfest features German food, music, and beer

definitions: four-year period between Olympic Games, used for dating in ancient Greece
staging of the modern Olympic Games or any similar international competition
examples: The ancient Greeks dated events by Olympiads starting from 776 BC
Each Olympiad represents four years in the ancient calendar
The Tokyo Olympiad was postponed from 2020 to 2021
She won three gold medals during the last summer Olympiad
